item.title: GccCrossCompiler
item.description: Cross-Compilers > What’s a Cross Compiler ? - A cross Compiler is simply a compiler that runs on the host platform (for example MacOS), and generate executables for the target platform (for example Windows). > Why we need a Cross Compiler ? - The only reason not to use a cross compiler is if you're generating executables for your own machine, where both the host and the targets are the same, and it's not the case for our projects now.
